Ingredients: 500g lamb, 1 large onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 cup coconut milk, 2 tbsp soy sauce, salt
 Instructions: Marinate lamb in soy sauce. Sauté onions and garlic, add lamb and brown. Pour in coconut milk, simmer until lamb is tender. Serve with taro or yam.

Description: A traditional dish from Trinidad and Tobago made with chicken, rice, and coconut milk, flavored with curry powder.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g chicken, 2 cups rice, 1 large onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 cup coconut milk, 1 tsp curry powder, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Sauté onions and garlic, add chicken and brown. Add rice, coconut milk, curry powder, and water. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until rice is done and chicken is tender. Serve hot.

Description: A classic Tunisian dish of steamed couscous served with lamb, vegetables, and chickpeas, seasoned with harissa and spices.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g couscous, 500g lamb, 1 large onion, 2 carrots, 2 zucchinis, 1 can chickpeas, 1 tbsp tomato paste, 1 tsp harissa, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp turmeric, salt, olive oil
 Instructions: Steam couscous and set aside. Sauté onions, add lamb and brown. Add spices, tomato paste, and water, simmer until lamb is tender. Add carrots, zucchinis, and chickpeas, cook until vegetables are tender. Serve meat and vegetables over couscous.

Description: A popular Turkish dish where lamb or chicken is marinated in yogurt and spices, then grilled or skewered.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1kg lamb or chicken, 2 cups yogurt, 4 cloves garlic, 1 large onion, 1 tbsp cumin, 1 tbsp paprika, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Marinate meat in yogurt, garlic, cumin, and paprika. Grill or skewer meat until cooked through. Serve with flatbread and vegetables.

Description: A traditional dish from Turkmenistan made with rice, lamb, carrots, and spices, cooked until tender.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g rice, 500g lamb, 2 large carrots, 1 large onion, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1/2 tsp turmeric, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Sauté onions, add lamb and brown. Add spices, water, and simmer until lamb is tender. Add julienned carrots, cook until soft. Stir in rice, add water, cook until rice is done. Serve hot.

Description: A staple food in Tuvalu made from boiled and mashed pulaka mixed with coconut cream.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g pulaka (swamp taro), 1 cup coconut cream, salt
 Instructions: Peel and slice pulaka, boil until tender. Mash with coconut cream and salt. Serve as a side dish.

Description: A popular Ugandan dish made with boiled and mashed green bananas, often served with a tomato and onion sauce.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g green bananas, 1 large onion, 2 tomatoes, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp curry powder, salt
 Instructions: Peel and slice bananas, boil until tender. Sauté onions, garlic, and tomatoes. Add boiled bananas, curry powder, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Description: A traditional Ukrainian beet soup made with potatoes, cabbage, and beef broth, served with sour cream.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g beets, 2 large potatoes, 1 large onion, 1 carrot, 1/2 cabbage, 4 cups beef broth, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp vinegar, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Sauté onions, garlic, and carrots. Add chopped beets, potatoes, and cabbage. Pour in beef broth, simmer until vegetables are tender. Add vinegar, salt, and pepper. Serve with sour cream.

Description: A traditional dish from the UAE made with lamb, rice, and spices, often served with a side of yogurt.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g lamb, 2 cups basmati rice, 1 large onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp baharat spice mix, 1/2 tsp turmeric, salt
 Instructions: Sauté onions and garlic, add lamb and brown. Add spices and water, simmer until lamb is tender. Stir in rice, cook until rice is done. Serve hot.

Description: A classic British dish of battered and fried cod served with fries and tartar sauce.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g cod, 4 large potatoes, 1 cup flour, 1 cup beer, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Cut cod into pieces, season with salt and pepper. Dip in batter made from flour and beer. Fry until golden brown. Serve with fries and tartar sauce.

Description: An American favorite consisting of a grilled beef patty served on a bun with cheese, lettuce, tomato, and condiments.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g ground beef, 4 burger buns, 4 slices cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, ketchup, mustard
 Instructions: Form ground beef into patties, season with salt and pepper. Grill or fry until cooked to preference. Assemble burgers with buns, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, ketchup, and mustard. Serve hot.

Description: A traditional Uruguayan dish of grilled beef ribs, often served with chimichurri sauce.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1kg beef ribs, 1 large onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 cup red wine, 1 cup beef broth, 1 tbsp oregano, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Marinate beef ribs in red wine, garlic, and oregano. Grill until cooked through, basting with beef broth. Serve with chimichurri sauce.

Description: A popular Uzbek dish of rice, lamb, and carrots, seasoned with cumin and coriander.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g rice, 500g lamb, 2 large carrots, 1 large onion, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1/2 tsp turmeric, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Sauté onions, add lamb and brown. Add spices, water, and simmer until lamb is tender. Add julienned carrots, cook until soft. Stir in rice, add water, cook until rice is done. Serve hot.

Description: A staple dish in Vanuatu made from boiled and mashed taro root mixed with coconut cream.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g taro root, 1 cup coconut cream, salt
 Instructions: Peel and slice taro, boil until tender. Mash with coconut cream and salt. Serve as a side dish.

Description: A Venezuelan dish of cornmeal cakes served with a savory filling of beef, onions, and tomatoes.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g cornmeal, 1 cup water, 1 cup milk, 1 tbsp butter, salt
 Instructions: Mix cornmeal with water and milk, cook until thickened. Stir in butter and salt. Serve as a side dish.

Description: A famous Vietnamese noodle soup made with beef, rice noodles, and fresh herbs, flavored with lime and fish sauce.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 500g beef, 1 large onion, 2 tomatoes, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, salt and pepper
 Instructions: Sauté onions and garlic, add beef and brown. Add tomatoes and spices, simmer until beef is tender. Serve with arepas.

Description: A Yemeni dish of spiced chicken and rice, often served with a side of yogurt.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 200g rice noodles, 200g beef, 1 large onion, 4 cups beef broth, 2 cloves garlic, 1 thumb-sized ginger, 1 bunch cilantro, 1 lime, fish sauce, bean sprouts
 Instructions: Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger. Add beef broth and bring to a boil. Add sliced beef and rice noodles, cook until tender. Serve with cilantro, lime wedges, fish sauce, and bean sprouts.

Description: A staple food in Zambia made from maize flour, cooked into a thick porridge and served with meat or vegetable stew.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 1 whole chicken, 2 cups basmati rice, 1 large onion, 4 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp baharat spice mix, salt
 Instructions: Sauté onions and garlic, add chicken and brown. Add spices and water, simmer until chicken is tender. Stir in rice, cook until rice is done. Serve hot.

Description: A staple food in Zimbabwe made from maize flour, cooked into a thick porridge and served with meat or vegetable stew.
Recipe:
Ingredients: 2 cups maize flour, 4 cups water, salt
 Instructions: Boil water and add a pinch of salt. Gradually add maize flour, stirring continuously until thickened. Serve with meat or vegetable stew.
